META.DESCRIPTION: Community guidelines and rules for Coding Global
META.KEYWORDS: rules, guidelines, community standards, code of conduct
META.TITLE: Rules - Coding Global

RULE_1.TITLE: 1. Discord guidelines
RULE_1.CONTENT: The Discord Community Guidelines apply to Programming [DE / EN]; users can view these at https://discord.com/guidelines.

RULE_2.TITLE: 2. Language
RULE_2.CONTENT: The language of our community is German and English. In the voice channel, "Public [DE]" German is the primary language. Users can speak English voluntarily. However, users must speak English in the Voice Channel "Public [EN]".

RULE_3.TITLE: 3. Asking questions
RULE_3.CONTENT:
3.1 Nobody is obliged to help or answer a question. Help is generally free of charge.  
3.2 Members with the role of "HELPER" have volunteered to help with questions.  
3.3 Pinging members to expect a faster response is not allowed.  
3.4 Don't ask questions like "Does anyone know about XY?" ask the question directly, see also ➔ https://dontasktoask.com/.  
3.5 Note the thread "How do I ask a good question?" on Stackoverflow ➔ https://stackoverflow.com/help/how-to-ask.

RULE_4.TITLE: 4. Recording
RULE_4.CONTENT: The recording of videos (screen sharing, webcam) and sound (voice chat) is not permitted on this Discord.

RULE_5.TITLE: 5. Advertising
RULE_5.CONTENT: Any kind of third-party advertising is prohibited.

RULE_6.TITLE: 6. Moderators
RULE_6.CONTENT: The moderation team has the right to take appropriate actions against a user, even if a certain rule has not been explicitly violated.

RULE_7.TITLE: 7. Direct messages
RULE_7.CONTENT: Please refrain from sending direct messages to the administrators.

RULE_8.TITLE: 8. Dissemination of personal information
RULE_8.CONTENT: Dissemination of other people's personal information of any kind without their consent is prohibited and will result in a permanent ban.

RULE_9.TITLE: 9. Enforcement of a measure
RULE_9.CONTENT: The interpretation of the rules is at the discretion of the respective administrator.

RULE_10.TITLE: 10. AI Use / Spam / Job listings
RULE_10.CONTENT: The use of AI to make job listings or other spam content is not permitted. Users found doing so will be jailed, muted, or banned.

RULE_11.TITLE: 11. Fake Skills / Code Stacks
RULE_11.CONTENT: Falsely claiming to have skills or experience for the purpose of scamming or obtaining jobs is prohibited. Users must be able to prove their skills.

RULE_12.TITLE: 12. No DM
RULE_12.CONTENT: No direct messages without previous authorization. If someone reports you, you may be muted or restricted.

META.TITLE: JavaScript - Coding Global
META.DESCRIPTION: Learn JavaScript with comprehensive guides, tutorials, and best practices
META.KEYWORDS: javascript, js, web development, programming, tutorials

WHY_JAVASCRIPT.TITLE: Why JavaScript?
WHY_JAVASCRIPT.CONTENT: JavaScript is the easiest path to becoming a full-stack developer. With a single language, you can build everything from interactive websites to server-side applications, mobile apps, and even desktop software.

WEB_DEV_SPEEDRUN.TITLE: Web Dev Speedrun
WEB_DEV_SPEEDRUN.DESCRIPTION: This is the exact path I took to learn web development. Follow these resources in order to build a good foundation in HTML, CSS, and JavaScript. Each resource builds on the previous one.

NODEJS.TITLE: Node.js
NODEJS.CONTENT_1: Node.js lets you run JavaScript on the server, making you a true full-stack developer. With Node.js, you can build APIs, handle databases, and create complete web applications using the same language you learned for the frontend. Download it from

REACT.TITLE: React
REACT.CONTENT: Once you've learned the basics and Node.js, it's time to master React. React is the most popular JavaScript library for building user interfaces and is used by companies like Meta, Netflix, and Airbnb.

SHADCN.TITLE: Designing with shadcn/ui
SHADCN.DESCRIPTION: is a collection of beautifully designed, accessible components that you can copy and paste into your apps. It's built on top of Radix UI and Tailwind CSS, giving you full control over your components.
SHADCN.BLOCKS_DESCRIPTION: These libraries provide pre-built components and blocks that work seamlessly with shadcn/ui.
SHADCN.UTILS_DESCRIPTION: Helpful tools for customizing and extending shadcn/ui.

REACT_DOCS.TITLE: React Official Docs
REACT_DOCS.DESCRIPTION: The best place to learn React from scratch

META.TITLE: Python - Coding Global
META.DESCRIPTION: Master Python with guides, tutorials, and best practices for all skill levels
META.KEYWORDS: python, programming, tutorials, data science, automation

PYTHON.TITLE: Python
PYTHON.CONTENT_1: Python is really only relevant for specific fields like data science, machine learning, scientific computing, and automation scripting. Outside of these areas, it's not particularly useful.
PYTHON.CONTENT_2: Many people choose Python as their first language because they think it's simple. While the syntax is readable, this simplicity doesn't transfer well to other languages or real-world development. If you want to become a full-stack developer, JavaScript is a much better choice since it works on both frontend and backend.
PYTHON.CONTENT_3: But if you really want to learn Python, check out

META.TITLE: Cyber Security - Coding Global
META.DESCRIPTION: Learn cyber security fundamentals, best practices, and techniques to protect your applications
META.KEYWORDS: cyber security, security, hacking, penetration testing, infosec

INTRODUCTION.TITLE: Introduction
INTRODUCTION.CONTENT_1: Let's be honest - most of us got into cyber security because we wanted to be hackers. We imagined ourselves breaking into systems, bypassing firewalls, and doing cool stuff like in the movies. Then reality hit: turns out hacking is mostly just... coding. A lot of coding.
INTRODUCTION.CONTENT_2: But that's actually the good news. The skills you learn in cyber security - understanding systems, networks, and how software works - make you a better developer overall. Whether you end up in pentesting, security engineering, or just writing more secure code, it all starts with the fundamentals.

LEARNING_PLATFORMS.TITLE: Learning Platforms
LEARNING_PLATFORMS.DESCRIPTION: The best way to learn cyber security is by doing. These platforms offer hands-on challenges, CTFs, and virtual labs where you can practice legally and safely.

TRYHACKME.TITLE: TryHackMe
TRYHACKME.DESCRIPTION: Free online platform for learning cyber security with hands-on exercises and labs

HACKTHEBOX.TITLE: Hack The Box
HACKTHEBOX.DESCRIPTION: Cyber mastery platform with beginner-friendly modules and real-world challenges

PICOCTF.TITLE: picoCTF
PICOCTF.DESCRIPTION: Free computer security education program by Carnegie Mellon University

ROOTME.TITLE: Root Me
ROOTME.DESCRIPTION: Platform for practicing hacking skills with challenges and virtual environments

CISCO.TITLE: Cisco Networking Academy
CISCO.DESCRIPTION: Learn cybersecurity, networking, and Python from Cisco's official training program

META.TITLE: Vibe Coding - Coding Global
META.DESCRIPTION: Discover tips and techniques for achieving flow state and maximum productivity while coding
META.KEYWORDS: vibe coding, productivity, flow state, coding tips, developer experience

WHAT_IS_VIBE_CODING.TITLE: What is Vibe Coding?
WHAT_IS_VIBE_CODING.CONTENT_1: Vibe coding is a new approach to programming where you describe what you want in natural language and let AI build it for you. Instead of writing every line of code yourself, you guide the AI with prompts and let it handle the implementation.
WHAT_IS_VIBE_CODING.CONTENT_2: The term was coined by Andrej Karpathy in this tweet:
WHAT_IS_VIBE_CODING.CONTENT_3: To vibe code effectively, you need the right tools. Here are the best AI-powered editors and CLIs available today.

CHOOSING_THE_BEST_MODEL.TITLE: Choosing the Best Model
CHOOSING_THE_BEST_MODEL.CONTENT_1: The AI model you use matters just as much as the tool. You can find the latest rankings of AI models for web development on the
CHOOSING_THE_BEST_MODEL.CONTENT_2: That said, Claude models by Anthropic consistently rank at the top for coding tasks. If you want the best results for vibe coding, Claude is usually the way to go.

MY_SETUP.TITLE: My Setup
MY_SETUP.CONTENT_2: for my vibe coding workflow. It integrates Claude directly into VSCode with agentic capabilities.
MY_SETUP.CONTENT_3: To help gather context for AI assistants, I also built the
MY_SETUP.CONTENT_4: extension. It automatically collects files based on import dependencies, making it easy to provide your codebase context to any AI assistant.

AI_EDITORS.TITLE: AI Editors
AI_EDITORS.DESCRIPTION: These editors have AI deeply integrated into the coding experience, allowing you to chat with AI, generate code, and get intelligent completions.

CURSOR.TITLE: Cursor
CURSOR.DESCRIPTION: AI-first code editor built on VSCode

AI_CLIS.TITLE: AI CLIs
AI_CLIS.DESCRIPTION: Command-line tools that let you vibe code directly from your terminal. These are great for quick tasks, automation, and working in any editor you prefer.

GEMINI_CLI.TITLE: Gemini CLI
GEMINI_CLI.DESCRIPTION: Google's AI coding assistant for terminal
